授業目的: In this course Japanese Popular Culture A we will begin by gaining an insight into the notion of popular culture. Moving on to Japanese popular culture, we will discuss its global influence from the perspective of soft power. After positioning Japanese popular culture within its historical context, we will get an insight into media studies. Leaning onto methodological approaches of Jaqueline Berndt, Azuma Hiroki, Thomas LaMarre, etc, we will explore different facets of manga from the perspective of history, media-studies, gender-studies/psychoanalysis, reception studies, and other.
到達目標:
Through a combination of lectures, student presentation, analysis of works and discussion, we will gain awareness of the development, interrelationship of popular media and its cultural role.
Lectures on history and methodology will be supplemented with reading and watching examples of popular media and methodological materials.
Emphasis on the student group-presentation, and final assignment may be an essay as well as original art-work.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
The class will be conducted face-to-face in a designated classroom (subject to change).
For students who have applied for online class participation simultaneous and two-way ZOOM class will be provided.

第3回: "Face to face class"  Globalization, soft power
